problem_summary_simple: Find the number of unique 3-node cycles in a maze represented by rooms and corridors.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through all possible triplets of nodes (i, j, k) and check if they form a cycle using an adjacency list.
key_insights: The problem asks for cycles of length 3 (triangles) in an undirected graph.
An efficient way to find triangles is to iterate through each node, then its neighbors, and then their neighbors to check for a closing edge.
Using sets for adjacency lists allows for O(1) average time complexity for checking edge existence.
